column4: hey guys, i just samba shared my home folder so i can copy some music onto my windows pc (don't yell, but please help), and what happened is that i Set it up, and then when i try to connect to it, i don't know the user name or password in windows, what would the defaults be ?
yrd
do "sudo smbpasswd -a <username>" replace with your username
it will prompt you for a password, do NOT give it your login password
nope, lemme see your /etc/samba/smb.conf in pastebin please
why not my login password ?
it was a bit late.......can i just change it ?
if you want, its a minor security thing
just do "smbpasswd" in terminal to change it
as for not being able to see your shares, I need to see your /etc/samba/smb.conf
its encrypted, it just gets sent over the network, its up to you man
no swearing please
what went wrong?
error?
ooooh you are sooo screwed...
we need real errors, and stop with the aacks please =)
it stops there?
it repeats
does it ever boot?
ok, got a live disc?
throw it in and boot up
fsck the drive =)
nope, we need a live environment
we are going to run a file system check, see whats going on
